telemOptInLabel.message: Share anonymous detection and device data with  $mb$
telemOptInLabel.description: Directly visible text to convince users to opt in to telemetry

telemOptInTooltip.message: We collect data anonymously whenever a threat is detected or blocked. It helps us create a better user experience and it makes our products better at fighting malware.
telemOptInTooltip.description: Tooltip for when user hovers over visible opt in text

factoryResetText.description: Factory reset and clear Browser Guard storage area text.

blockExplainAdware.message: Adware is a form of malicious software which displays unwanted advertising on your computer.

blockExplainCompromised.message: Compromised sites (or servers) are otherwise legitimate sites that are being used by hackers without the owner's knowledge. Compromised sites are often used to house and spread malware.
blockExplainCompromised.description: Text explaining what a compromised site is

blockExplainExploit.message: Exploits are a type of malware that take advantage of bugs and vulnerabilities in a system in order to allow the exploit's creator to take control.
blockExplainExploit.description: Text explaining what an exploit is

blockExplainFradulent.message: Fraudulent websites appear to be one thing, like a tech support site, a dating site, or a shopping site with illegal products or great deals, but they're really scams to try to steal your information or credit card details.
blockExplainFradulent.description: Text explaining what a fradulent site is

blockExplainHijack.message: A hijacker is a type of that malware that modifies a web browser's settings without users' permission, usually to inject unwanted ads into the browser or redirect to scam sites.
blockExplainHijack.description: Text explaining what a hijacker is

blockExplainMalvertising.message: Malvertising, or "malicious advertising," is the use of online advertising to distribute malware with little to no user interaction required.

blockExplainMalware.message: Malware, or "malicious software," is an umbrella term that refers to any malicious program or code that is harmful to systems.

blockExplainPharma.message: Pharma is short for "pharmacy." In cybersecurity, the expression refers to spam or websites that traffic in fake or illegal medication. These sites may also sell legal medication, but in violation of local laws.
blockExplainPharma.description: Text explaining what illegal pharma sites are

blockExplainPhishing.message: Phishing scams attempt to obtain your information by presenting themselves as legitimate websites, then asking for your password, credit card details, or other sensitive information.

blockExplainRansomware.message: Ransomware is a form of malware that locks you out of your device and/or encrypts your files, then forces you to pay a ransom to get them back.

blockExplainReputation.message: This website is suspected of being compromised or hosting a potential privacy or security threat.

blockExplainRiskware.message: Riskware, or "risky software," describes legitimate software programs that contain loopholes or vulnerabilities that can be exploited by hackers for malicious purposes.

blockExplainScam.message: Possible suspicious activity encompasses a variety of behaviors that are commonly attributed to technical support scams, cryptojacking, browser hijacking, and other types of harmful, risky, and potentially unwanted objects.

blockExplainSpam.message: Spam is an undesired communication, often an email or call, that gets sent out in bulk. Spam wastes time and resources, so many communication tools have built-in ways of minimizing it.

blockExplainSpyware.message: Spyware is a type of malware that gathers information on a device and sends it to a third-party actor or organization that wouldn't normally have access. In the past, this term was also used for adware and cookies.

blockExplainTrojan.message: Trojans are programs that claim to perform one function but actually do another, typically malicious. Trojans can take the form of attachments, downloads, and fake videos/programs and, once active on a system, may do a number of things, including stealing sensitive data or taking control of the device.
blockExplainTrojan.description: Text explaining what a Trojan is

blockExplainWorm.message: Worms are a type of malware similar to viruses, but they do not need to be attached to another program in order to spread.
blockExplainWorm.description: Text explaining what a Worm is

blockExplainDefault.message: Possible suspicious activity encompasses a variety of behaviors that are commonly attributed to technical support scams, cryptojacking, browser hijacking, and other types of harmful, risky, and potentially unwanted objects.
blockExplainDefault.description: Text explaining a default block that has no specifics as above

riskyPatternExplanation.message: $mb$ blocks risky patterns that either come from websites that see relatively light traffic or may contain potentially malicious content. This is intended to protect you from new $type$. However, if you trust content from this site and would like to proceed, click "Continue".
riskyPatternExplanation.description: Text explaining why a risky pattern block could occur

suspiciousContentExplanation.message: $mb$ scans downloads started in the browser and may block/remove the item if it looks suspicious. If you trust this content/site and would like to proceed, click "Continue".
suspiciousContentExplanation.description: Text explaining why a suspicious content (download) block could occur

suspiciousTldExplanation.message: $mb$ blocked this page because it uses a suspicious top level domain (TLD). These are frequently used by scam or phishing sites, but can be used by legitimate websites as well. If you trust this website, please click CONTINUE TO SITE. Otherwise, choose GO BACK.
suspiciousTldExplanation.description: Text explaining why a suspicious TLD block could occur

reputationBlockExplanation.message: $mb$ blocks pages that come from websites with relatively light traffic and have been reported to have malicious activity.  If you trust this website, please click CONTINUE TO SITE.  Otherwise, choose GO BACK.
reputationBlockExplanation.description: Text explaining why a reputation block could occur

defaultBlockExplanation.message: $mb$ blocked this website because it may contain $type$ activity.

oap2faUnresolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when 2FA is not enabled

oap2faUnresolvedExplanation.message:
Recommended by security experts, two-factor authentication (2FA) ensures your account is secure even id someone gets your password.
It adds a second step - like a code sent to your phone - to block unauthorized access.
It only takes a few minutes to set up and gives your account strong protection.
oap2faUnresolvedExplanation.description: OAP recommendation explanation when 2FA is not enabled

oap2faWhatToDoTitle.description: OAP recommendation what to do title for 2FA

oap2faWhatToDoStep1.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 1 for 2FA

oap2faWhatToDoStep2.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 2 for 2FA

oap2faResolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when 2FA is enabled

oap2faResolvedActionMessage.message: You've already set up two-factor authentication. Well done! This extra layer of security is helping protect your account.
oap2faResolvedActionMessage.description: OAP recommendation action message when 2FA is enabled

oapRecoveryEmailUnresolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when recovery email is not set

oapRecoveryEmailUnresolvedExplanation.message:
A recovery email helps you get back into your account if you ever forget your password or get locked out.
It only takes a minute to add and can save you a lot of trouble later.
oapRecoveryEmailUnresolvedExplanation.description: OAP recommendation explanation when recovery email is not set

oapRecoveryEmailWhatToDoTitle.description: OAP recommendation what to do title for recovery email

oapRecoveryEmailWhatToDoStep1.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 1 for recovery email

oapRecoveryEmailWhatToDoStep2.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 2 for recovery email

oapRecoveryEmailWhatToDoStep3.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 3 for recovery email

oapRecoveryEmailResolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when recovery email is set

oapRecoveryEmailResolvedActionMessage.message: You've added a recovery email to your account. Well done! Just make sure it's one you have access to.
oapRecoveryEmailResolvedActionMessage.description: OAP recommendation action message when recovery email is set

oapRecoveryPhoneUnresolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when recovery phone is not set

oapRecoveryPhoneUnresolvedExplanation.message: A recovery phone number helps you get back into your account if you forget your password or get locked out. Setting it up is quick and adds a safe way to verify your identity.
oapRecoveryPhoneUnresolvedExplanation.description: OAP recommendation explanation when recovery phone is not set

oapRecoveryPhoneWhatToDoTitle.description: OAP recommendation what to do title for recovery phone

oapRecoveryPhoneWhatToDoStep1.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 1 for recovery phone

oapRecoveryPhoneWhatToDoStep2.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 2 for recovery phone

oapRecoveryPhoneWhatToDoStep3.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 3 for recovery phone

oapRecoveryPhoneResolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when recovery phone is set

oapRecoveryPhoneResolvedActionMessage.message: You've added a recovery phone number. Well done! This helps you regain access if something goes wrong. Just make sure the number is still active and you can use it.
oapRecoveryPhoneResolvedActionMessage.description: OAP recommendation action message when recovery phone is set

oapPasswordChangeUnresolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title when password update is recommended

oapPasswordChangeUnresolvedExplanation.message: It's been a while since you changed your password, or you might have a security concern. Updating your password now adds strong protection to your account and personal info.
oapPasswordChangeUnresolvedExplanation.description: OAP recommendation explanation when password update is recommended

oapPasswordChangeWhatToDoStep1.description: OAP recommendation what to do step 1 for password change

oapPublicProfileUnresolvedTitle.description: OAP recommendation title for public profile info

oapPublicProfileUnresolvedExplanation.message: Your connected apps have access to your publicly available profile info. To limit exposure, hide the info you don't want to share with the public and connected apps.

oapPublicProfileWhatToDoStep1.message: <link https://myaccount.google.com/profile>Go to your Google account profile settings</link>

oapPublicProfileResolvedActionMessage.message: You have hidden the info you don't want to share with the public and connected apps. You're good to go!
